acquirer.title: Acquirer
acquirer.desc: Access guides and resources for acquirers.

merchant.title: Merchant
merchant.desc: Find merchant onboarding and integration help.

acquirerIntro.title: Who Can Be an
acquirerIntro.intro: Becoming an Acquirer is a significant step for merchants who wish to expand their payment processing capabilities and offer seamless transactions to their customers. An Acquirer is typically a merchant or organization that is responsible for processing card payments and managing merchant accounts.
acquirerIntro.requirement1: Merchant must have been operating for a minimum of 6 months.
acquirerIntro.requirement2: Merchant should have processed at least 100 transactions during this period.
acquirerIntro.requirement3: Maintain a good transaction record with minimal chargebacks or disputes.
acquirerIntro.requirement4: Provide valid business registration and compliance documents.
acquirerIntro.requirement5: Demonstrate the ability to manage payment settlements and reconciliation.
acquirerIntro.whyText: Becoming an Acquirer allows merchants to take control of their payment processing, improve transaction efficiency, and offer a better experience to their customers. It opens up new business opportunities and helps build trust with partners and clients.
acquirerIntro.benefit1: Direct access to payment networks and faster settlements.
acquirerIntro.benefit2: Enhanced security and fraud prevention tools.
acquirerIntro.benefit3: Ability to onboard and manage multiple merchants.
acquirerIntro.benefit4: Customizable payment solutions for different business needs.
acquirerIntro.benefit5: Detailed reporting and analytics for transaction monitoring.
acquirerIntro.benefit6: Priority support and dedicated account management.
